channel.title: Fool and Butler changes
channel.description:
So, I think I don't think I need to introduce The Fool class. In my opinion, everything is fine in it, except the penalty upon execution, it doesn't make any sense for me. Why? Let me explain.
It only benefits the evil roles. Not BD. Being unable to vote for 2 days doesn't harm the evil roles at all, making their safety almost guaranteed. And if there is a suspected evil which is actually a fool, the evil roles can easily control the judgement, and vote execute without suffering any penalties. I'm going to use Town of Salem as example, if there is a suspected evil neutral role, then even the evil faction has a reason to be afraid of something, aka death (not guaranteed). There may be something I missed but this is all I can think of.
Now the Butler and the Black Wine ability even if it's probably a temporary change, to balance out the Toxic Wine ability, it's still a bad idea. It does not benefit BD in any ways, and it shouldn't have been added in the first place. Just have 1 night ability and problem solved (temporarily).
I think this is all I had to say. Peace!
